definitions.definition: A substitute (usually of a person, position or role).
examples: A mixture of horseradish and mustard often serves as a surrogate for wasabi.

definitions.definition: A person or animal that acts as a substitute for the social or pastoral role of another, such as a surrogate parent .
A deputy for a bishop in granting licences for marriage.
A politician or person of influence campaigning for a presidential candidate .
A judicial officer of limited jurisdiction , who administers matters of probate and intestate succession and, in some cases, adoptions .
Any of a range of Unicode codepoints which are used in pairs in UTF-16 to represent characters beyond the Basic Multilingual Plane.

main_definition: A substitute (usually of a person, position or role).
secondary_definitions: A person or animal that acts as a substitute for the social or pastoral role of another, such as a surrogate parent .
( chiefly British ) A deputy for a bishop in granting licences for marriage.
( US , politics ) A politician or person of influence campaigning for a presidential candidate .
( US law ) A judicial officer of limited jurisdiction , who administers matters of probate and intestate succession and, in some cases, adoptions .
( computing ) Any of a range of Unicode codepoints which are used in pairs in UTF-16 to represent characters beyond the Basic Multilingual Plane.
